pair.Response:
Prompt: What was the case of Northern Securities Co. v. United States about?
Response: Northern Securities Co. v. United States was a case in which the Supreme Court of the United States considered the legality of a combination between two railroad companies under the Sherman Anti-Trust Act. The Court held that the combination was illegal because it restrained interstate and international commerce in violation of the Act. The Court also established the principle that the Act applies to all direct restraints imposed by any combination, conspiracy or monopoly upon such trade or commerce. The case was decided on October Term, 1903, with Justice Harlan affirming the decree.
